website_summaries.verdict: Digital convection model that's large enough to toast 6 pieces of bread.
pros: Good for both reheating and cooking food
Has an easy-access crumb tray and interior light
Heats quickly and cooks evenly, too
cons: Front of the toaster oven gets very hot

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that Oster cannot perfect the toaster oven after so ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned this immediately. The crumb tray does not fit securely no matter what I do. It leaves a 1/4" gap so that the hot air escapes the oven. The Toaster setting goes from a low of 1 to a high of 6. The lowest setting was acceptable but very brown. The medium #3 setting resulted in black, smoking, burned toast. I was replacing a similar Oster Toaster Oven that is 7+ years old. Disappointed that Oster cannot perfect the toaster oven after so many years of making almost the same model, Will try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Argyle Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster oven!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my first toaster oven! I wanted a more efficient way to reheat foods than using the oven--this turned out to be the perfect choice! I had looked at a more expensive Breville convection toaster oven, but in comparing the two side by side, I decided to go with the Oster not just for the almost $200 savings, but for the look--I just love the black finish and curved sides--it blends so nicely in my kitchen. So far, I have used it to reheat my morning frittatas, roast beets, bake sweet potatoes, and toast pumpkin seeds--I could not be happier with the results!
customer_reviews.author: joni j

customer_reviews.title: Crapola
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about six months, but now pushing on the buttons does absolutely nothing. There are rare occasions where I can get it to work, but it is totally random and unreliable. Sadly, I bought two of these (one for my mother since I liked mine so much at first), but the return window has closed, so I am left with a non-working toaster oven. Look at other ovens before you decide to purchase, even if this is an "Amazon Choice". All I can report is MY experience, and this toaster oven is NOT recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Boheeber

customer_reviews.title: Works great, short power cord a concern
customer_reviews.text: Excellent overall but a few findings: 1. The way the glass front is attached to the frame which you pull open isnt airtight. A little liquid spilled while pulling a dish out and it went right in between the glass and the metal frame and there's no way to clean it besides possibly separating the glass from the frame via the screws 2. The rear and top of the oven get VERY hot so it needs plenty of clearance and dont keep any wires behind it. As such the power cord is too short because it touches the rear of the oven and I think that could be a safety hazard
customer_reviews.author: Varun Sehgal

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Heat
customer_reviews.text: After 40 minutes on convection bake at 450 deg, the oven temp was barely over 300. It will not bake a pizza, or even biscuits at that temp. It also takes forever to turn out toast. More wasted money, but I should have tested it immediately after receiving it and sent it back. Contacted Oster support who won't talk to you unless you have a receipt. They won't honor their warranty with an Amazon invoice, so the company is as rotten as their products.
customer_reviews.author: Hexalectris

customer_reviews.title: No TIMER/BELL for the TOASTER FUNCTION
customer_reviews.text: Although I read countless reviews, I somehow missed that this toaster oven DOES NOT have a timer/bell function when you are TOASTING. We followed all packaged instructions AND called Oster twice (in case we were so incompetent we couldn’t follow simple directions). So to be clear...NO TIMER ON TOAST FUNCTION. YES TIMER ON ALL OTHER FUNCTIONS. We really needed this as a toaster, so it is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Ntbtebmkb

customer_reviews.title: Don’t trust this product!
customer_reviews.text: My Oster Toaster Oven worked just fine for two months. Then the clock and timer did not work at all and the baking would just stop and automatically cut off . I would have to restart the baking and try to estimate the time needed to complete the process. The toaster oven was warranted only for one month. (I did not catch that returnable date until I tried to return). I would not recommend this to anyone.......
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: A great toaster oven still working perfectly seven years later
customer_reviews.text: We bought this toaster oven on January 1st 2013 after my wife decided she didn't want to replace our microwave that failed. Since the purchase date it has seen almost daily use reheating leftovers, toasting breakfast foods, warming bread or cooking pizzas or smaller packaged dinners. Every function continues to work without issue. Ours tends to cook a little hot, but that is easily compensated for by just adjusting the temperature 25-degrees lower than your recipe may call for. Overall a great toaster oven that I hope they still make when ours eventually fails as I would definitely buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: MTM

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster Oven
customer_reviews.text: I've had this toaster oven for almost two years. It's spacious, yet compact on the kitchen counter. Great for preparing dishes when you don't want to heat up the whole house with the big oven. I've found though that it cooks food, especially pizza, faster than the pizza directions might indicate, so it's best to keep a close eye on the doneness of the food. I've also noticed that the clock changes inadvertently when I use the oven. It may be something that I'm doing wrong but if so, I haven't figured it out yet. Overall, I think this is a very good value in toaster ovens.
customer_reviews.author: Gulf16

customer_reviews.title: Great size & features
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable heat settings even for toast! Love all the settings available - can choose regular oven, convection oven, broil, toast, pizza, defrost, all with timer and temp settings. It works better than my microwave to defrost. I love the evenness of the toast - best toaster oven toast I've seen. It's nice to be able to use my full size baking pans. Read manual - the pizza setting is fixed on 400 degrees for 20 minutes and my favorite requires 425 for 15 minutes so I use the convection oven instead.
customer_reviews.author: TracyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Too hot to handle
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'd looked at the reviews and Q&As carefully, but never saw any mention that changing the temp for baking is done only in 25-degree increments. More troublesome, though, was that the door handle gets hot when the oven is in use. And, if you get your fingers near either end of the handle it's hot enough that you could get burned. Returned it and bought a Breville -- much more expensive but a much better toaster oven.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Marty

customer_reviews.title: No trays
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why Amazon refused to post my previous review. I've looked all over and I cannot find any trays that will fit inside the seven. It comes with one Grill that does and then the other pieces are small so you don't get to use the full surface size. I just want a baking sheet or tray that will fit in there and there are none anywhere that have that size of 14 in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... for my mother as a gift and she immediately loved its design and overall how well made it is
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother as a gift and she immediately loved its design and overall how well made it is. A few months in and it no longer heats up. Seems it just burned out.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli HTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Oster Large Capacity Countertop 6-Slice Digital a solid performer.
customer_reviews.text: The Oster Large Capacity Countertop 6-Slice Digital Toaster Oven is doing an admiral job of baking and broiling. We generally cook at temps. between 350 - 450 degrees. The touch control "buttons" are easy to read and laid out logically. It has a bright interior light, when turned on, reaches the set temp. in a reasonable amount of time and maintains it steadily. The ample size affords sufficient room for larger toaster oven baking sheets and pans, yet it fits on our counter top without taking up excess space. I'm very happy with this oven anddo recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave K.

customer_reviews.title: Very dangerous machine - - - Be Careful!!!
customer_reviews.text: The entire unit gets unacceptably HOT - - - It is very slow and energy inefficient. The manufactured failed to insulate the 3 sides as walls as the top and bottom of the oven. Someone could get seriously burned if the touch any part of the oven after it has been activated. MORE Important, in the wrong place, I believe that this oven could cause a fire, damaging their kitchen if not possibly their entire house. Possibly all of the Oven/Toaster function the same way as this Oster - I do not want any such device in my house
customer_reviews.author: Mr A C Humphreys

customer_reviews.title: It has some quirks
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for two years now. I like cooking quickly without needing to use the entire oven. It does a good job and heats evenly. My complaints: - It heats faster than package directions. You need to keep an eye on things. This is less of a complaint once you know, because then you get food faster. - The outside of the unit gets very hot. Take care of what is near it. - The clock is always off from the actual time. It runs fast. Doesn't affect the performance, but if it's going to always be on as an energy drain, it could at least perform its designated function and display the correct time.
customer_reviews.author: CGutt

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Really like the looks and how this oven works. So far, I have had no problems with it and I have used it a lot. Still learning how to get a good heat distribution on some things though. I'm sure that will come with use. Only real complaint I have with it is that I wish the digital buttons on it were more sensitive. You have to hang on to the toaster while you are pushing on them so you won't be moving your toaster all over the countertop. With my air fryer, you barely touch the buttons and they work......with this, you have to really push them to work. Other than that, it's a nice toaster oven!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets WAY too hot; turns off randomly
customer_reviews.text: At first I gave it 4 stars, but not anymore. I've found that using the temp above 400°, after a few heating cycles, the heating elements STAY ON AND DO NOT TURN OFF. It burnt my pizza agyer only 6 minutes in the oven at 400°. I used it at 375° and the temperature seemed steady until it turned itself off after 25 minutes. Crap product, I was excited about it but now I'm going to ask for a refund!
customer_reviews.author: Josh B.

customer_reviews.title: Digital clock in this unit is VERY inaccurate!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this unit for a month. I have to reset the digital clock on it every other day, as it gains 1-2 minutes a day. I contacted Oster, and they told me my best solution was to 'send it back for replacement'. Since Amazon no longer carries this item, I'm stuck with it. As a lesser complaint, when making toast, because the bread is so far away from the heating elements, the bread gets very dried out before it actually toasts. A dedicated toaster would do a much better job of toasting bread/bagels.
customer_reviews.author: Mr_Cooncat

customer_reviews.title: Uneven heat; controls are horrible
customer_reviews.text: Heat: If I toast bread at the default (#3) or higher setting, it comes out much darker--sometimes burnt--at the back and just warm at the forward edge. Controls: The 'buttons' for selecting the function (Bake/Toast/Convection Oven), adjusting time/temperature, start, and stop are nasty, insensitive membrane-style keys that have to be pressed in exactly the right, very small area, and often have to be pressed hard enough that the unit slides back. Within those limitations, it does the job it's built to do. I bought mine in 2015 and now, January 2020, it's still working, so the durability is above average in this day of planned obsolescence.
customer_reviews.author: William M

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: Temperature setting can be a problem and the rack isn’t safe, as some of the other reviewers say. My biggest issue with this product is that you can’t be near this thing when it’s working or you will get burned. There’s no heat insulation whatsoever. It’s easy to clean and it will do a good job heating things up but that’s about it. I’ll let it run its course and get another one . Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Black Velvet

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but it's not really high quality.
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to toaster ovens, and I wonder why I never had one before. I now cook things that I never would have used the full-sized oven for (every sandwich can be a toasted sandwich!) But this one is a little on the cheapo side. The buttons need to be pressed hard to register, and the oven is very light, so you need to hold the oven with your other hand to be able to push buttons. Another minor issue. The pan is not designed to be easy to hold onto with pot holders or oven mitts. I always feel like I'm going to drop it. Otherwise, I got my money's worth, and use it very frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: A toaster oven that can handle an entire pie and cooks fairly quick....A+++
customer_reviews.text: Great size...cooked an entire pizza as well as a pan of brownies... This toaster oven is exactly as I hoped...seems every year we have gone through a new toaster oven and hopes this will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: panicthoughts

customer_reviews.title: Buttons Are Hard to Push
customer_reviews.text: Since my first review, this oven has gotten worse. Within a few months of use, all of the digital numbers (clock, cook time, temperature) have parts missing so that you can't tell the time, temperature, or cook time, except by guessing. Even worse, all the digital buttons have become really hard to operate. My knuckles have gotten sore from punching the numbers in order to set the clock, temperature, or cook time. I'm ordering a new toaster oven from Amazon--one that has dials on it. No more digital, touch-sensitive buttons for me. Touch sensitive--that's a real joke--there's nothing sensitive about them. Touch resistant would be a better phrase. This one's going to the curb.
customer_reviews.author: jderrico

customer_reviews.title: Love it as a mini oven replacement, toasting is however very uneven
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing for not making me heat up my big oven just to bake some chicken/pie/roast vegetable/other small items and I have definitely eaten more "grilled" cheese variety in the past 3 month than I have in the 5 years prior combined. However, as a bread toaster...this isn't great. 1st setting is too light, 2nd setting is too burnt, 3-5 are essentially useless. Not something I can't overcome with some monitoring and I don't toast enough for this to be a significant negative, but it's an issue. Overall I very much like this.
customer_reviews.author: PlayingWithFire

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The touch buttons do not work consistently. Have to unplug sometimes for the touch start button to go on and then it has to be touched a certain way. I can't get the minute on the clock time to change at all. I would have returned it but didn't have the box and am unable to drive or lift the toaster after hand surgery. I am very disappointed by the brand and for the cost it should work.
customer_reviews.author: James Shamblen

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Decent toaster oven for the price. Features I like: oven light, spacious, crumb tray, convection setting. Initially, the toaster setting was burning the bread but after subsequent attempts the controls seemed to settle down and is now browning the toast nicely. The one gripe I have is that the clock is fast. I would set the toaster's clock the same as all the other appliances in the kitchen and after a few days, the toaster clock would be at least 3 minutes ahead of the other clocks.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Sands

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Has been very reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This is a good little oven. I use it daily and it has been no problem. The top warms up in use, but is never intolerably hot. Large enough for all the oven work a couple will ever need to do. Cons: The electrical cord is short, but that is probably a safety feature. The functions are controlled by pressure sensitive pads that can be unresponsive if not pressed firmly. More importantly, the pad labels are not back-lit, so you'll need adequate ambient lighting to read them.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Grace

customer_reviews.title: What microwave?  I convection cook everything now
customer_reviews.text: How great it it to cook for two people without turning on the oven that comes with your stove? I love the convection oven the most and have not used the kitchen oven since I received this. I also have not used my microwave. Heating with convection is reasonably fast and just tastes so much better than using a microwave. In fact we are about to give our microwave away because I only use the kitchen timer feature now.
customer_reviews.author: DorothyFeht

customer_reviews.title: This Toaster Oven Exceeds our expections
customer_reviews.text: So far we like every single thing...The price, the functions,....The first night we had it I baked a pizza...just clicked on the Pizza mode and let it go...Perfect. I've baked items from Costco that I put in a smaller pan...easy peasy. Toast comes out perfectly done...That took a little getting used to how long to set the time. It toasts slowly so we've adjusted, putting the bread, English muffins, whatever, in early during the breakfast prep. I appreciated that the directions recommended using parchment paper rather than aluminum to cover something that needed to be heated or baked. Cleaning is simple. I highly recommend this toaster oven!
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic oven, can use convection or regular baking.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic oven, can use convection or regular baking. A 12" round pizza stone fits just great and makes the best 'za. The oven interior is big enough to cook a whole chicken. Also, Amazon delivered it in one day! You won't regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Don H

customer_reviews.title: Beat my expectations
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for toast - so we can load up to six slices at a time. But over the last couple months we have been using it more an more for roasts, frozen pizza, and even cooking a chicken. I'm impressed with the size of the oven - easily fitting a 12 inch pizza. Also impressed with the uniformity of the heat - certainly good to rotate food half way through the process but not all that necessary. And I found the controls easy to master and the automatic shut-off and real convenience.
customer_reviews.author: J. Aceti

customer_reviews.title: I do **NOT** recommend! Very dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I've had this toaster oven for less than a month and last night, as I was cooking some fries at 425 F, the oven door shattered! It made such a loud, alarming sound! I tried sifting through all the other negative reviews here to see if anyone else experienced this and was shocked to find that I seem to be the only one. I do **NOT** recommend! Very dangerous, be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good looking unit.
customer_reviews.text: Good looking appliance. Controls take a while to get used to. Have to figure out what 3,2,1,toast is,Minutes? Happy with it so far . Update - We started to have problems the handle was getting hot, the fan was noisy, and the bake timer stopped working. Also the thermostat seemed stuck on high. It was past Amazon's warrantee so we called the manufacturer. It took two weeks but they sent us a new one. Very happy now everything works, the handle doesn't get too hot, thermostat works and the fan(Convection bake) is almost silent. Happy once again. Hope it lasts. Not the Oster of yesteryear.
customer_reviews.author: William McGonigle

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but....
customer_reviews.text: Baked cookies in this last night and they came out great! Fits my small cookie sheet or a 6 well muffin pan. Not sure how easy it is to clean as I haven't gotten it dirty yet, time will tell. The one minus for me is that the cord is NOT 31 inches. It is 26 1/2 from unit to prong ends. For me, this is an annoyance since I had to re arrange my other appliances to get this closer to my outlet. For you it may be fine.
customer_reviews.author: J.m.

customer_reviews.title: Best I've bought!
customer_reviews.text: We've always had a toaster oven, never a toaster. They seem to get old/broken after 6 to 10 yrs. This is the BEST ONE we've had. The last one had a mechanical dial. The lettering wore off and the dial broke. Then it stopped working. I LOVE the digital. The oven rack is flimsy, it bends and has dislodged on me when half to 3/4 extended while tending to the food. If they added just 1mm of extra stainless steel to it, that would help a lot. This is a minor flaw. It also gets pretty hot on top and behind. Could use a little more insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Toaster Oven
customer_reviews.text: I had this same model for almost 8 years but during the moving the toaster fell down the stairs and broke down. I was searching the market for a new one. I look a lot of toaster oven and read a lot of reviews but decide it to buy the same one. Why? Although there are more efficiency and better performance toaster ovens out there, the decision came down because of the price and the dimension. I'm really happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Get it
customer_reviews.text: This has saved me during this quarantine. My oven went out just as quarantine started and this has fed my family of 5 ever since. It heats a little more toward the back but that is my only complaint and it really isnt that big of a deal. We've used this product multiple times a day and have no problems. Clean up is a cinch. I love this thing, don't even care if my oven ever gets replaced.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rice

customer_reviews.title: very nice oven/toaster
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a bigger electric oven, this one has the perfect size it 's bigger than regular toaster ovens but not huge where toasting a couple of slices of bread would be a waste of energy it has very nice cooking features like convection and it's digital which I was not too fond before buying it because it can lead to early problems but I am liking it now the only bad thing as other reviews pointed out is the fitting of the crumb tray which has a gap from where you loose heat.
customer_reviews.author: wise comprador

customer_reviews.title: Works good!
customer_reviews.text: I like it because it does a lot. It is bulky on the counter but we use it daily so we leave it there. it takes a long time to toast and you have to watch it because it will burn stuff even on toast 1 setting. Not all the time but for certain things. The convection works great. You just lower the Temperature from what is required by a regular oven. The glass door does get very hot while cooking so you have to be careful with that. But overall we like it! Especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: KSSchneider

customer_reviews.title: The Last Oven You'll Ever Need
customer_reviews.text: This little toaster oven is a gem! It cooks almost everything much faster than the instructions indicate, so keep an eye on things and set your timers a minute or two shorter than usual. I've used mine for a vast array of foods including baked mac & cheese (Convection Bake setting), burgers (broil), toast (toast), and countless other items. You'll be surprised at how much stuff actually fits in this tiny oven. I've had no issues with pizzas and other large items (within reason). It does all of this without overheating your kitchen! I recently moved in with 3 other roommates and we all use the toaster oven religiously, while our large kitchen oven sits in quiet desolation. :)
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Ketchum

customer_reviews.title: Alert!  Cardboard Inside!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and it is beautiful! However, when I took it out of the box and removed all tape, etc. and plugged it in, I noticed smoke. A large amount of smoke! Unbeknownst to me, there was cardboard packed in the very back of the machine. It was not visible at counter level. I was able to pull out pieces of burnt cardboard and shut it off. I was quite shaken. Nowhere on the instructions or box did it mention that cardboard was inside the product. If it had, I would have looked for it and would have avoided the fire. So, if you purchase this product -- Beware!
customer_reviews.author: B. Pernice

customer_reviews.title: Good oven that doesn't keep time.
customer_reviews.text: There is an odd thing wrong with this oven. I am curious if anyone else notices this. The clock get randomly faster. We watch it over days to try to see when it happens, and maybe it gains a minute here and there, and then one day it is 30 to 40 minutes ahead of the correct time! We re-set it regularly. We've only had it a month. It cooks great. We know how to do everything on it, so it's not like we don't know how to set the clock. We think it gains time during cooking, but we aren't totally sure. Anyway, it's a fine little oven that doesn't tell time very well.
customer_reviews.author: jack mills

customer_reviews.title: it's a toaster oven.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace our B&D model that lasted 8 years and was the same size and had the same functions. This one looked nicer and I liked that the button labels were not just painted on (we had to memorize the old ones). It cooks well but the clock will never keep the correct time, I think it resets if we don't acknowledge that it is done toasting by pressing the stop button even though it shuts off automatically. It also beeps every time you press a button which isn't great if you are trying not to wake up little kids every morning at dawn.
customer_reviews.author: SadxClown

customer_reviews.title: A Magical Device
customer_reviews.text: First let me say this is the third one I have bought and that I am severely handicapped and find it hard to use a regular large oven so several years ago I found myself looking for an alternative. I found this and I found the answer to everything I needed. I think I cooked nearly everything there was to cook in it and it came out perfect. It' s indispensable and an integral part of my household and when I need another one I will be getting this. The simplicity of use and efficiency it gives me is life changing.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Lido

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my Air Fryer oven
customer_reviews.text: As much as I as I wanted an air fryer oven, I tried one & didn't care for it. I decided to go back to a convection toaster oven & I am so glad I did. It takes up a bit of counter space, but no more than the air fryer oven did. I used to have a convection toaster oven, but it died after about 20 years of use. I do find I have to press the touch control buttons a bit harder than anticipated, but that is not a deal breaker for me. I would most definitely buy again, if the need arises & most definitely recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: GrannyLu

customer_reviews.title: The best I have found
customer_reviews.text: I really really love this Toaster Oven and I have never had one with a light in it. Love that feature. I haven't used all the features yet, but, if I have a problem I'll let you know. It is a little harder to figure out how I like my toast, but, I'll keep working on it. I'm just so happy I found this one and hope it lasts longer than the last 3 I had. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: joann49

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate !!!
customer_reviews.text: The most important thing for any oven is that the actual temperature inside is the one you've set it too. The thermometer I placed inside the oven reads at 400 degrees when the oven was set to 350!!! What else do you need to know.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase and does the job for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have had this oven for almost 2 years. I was giving it a quick clean and thought I need to leave a review. I normally don't do reviews. I use the over several times a week. Not just for toast. I bake loaves of bread, make casseroles. It has exceeded expectations. You just have to learn how to adjust you times and tweak the temps slightly. It runs just a little hot and you have to learn what you set the little rack on. I've not burned anything yet. It is definitely a little work horse. Highly recommend this little toaster oven that does more than just toast.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for baking not toasting
customer_reviews.text: Not so great for toasting which is what I really wanted it for. Takes FOREVER to toast and one side gets toasted more quickly than the other because the adjustable rack sits either 1/3 from the top or 1/3 from the bottom. No option directly in the middle. But it does hold more than a traditional toaster oven which is great. On the plus side, when used as an oven it heats very quickly and usually gets things cooked faster than the recommended time, for example, when cooking frozen chicken tenders for my grandson which is great when he’s “starving.” All in all, I ended up keeping it so if I’m not totally happy
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: This toaster cooks my food, however I know there are much better options out there. It does not preheat on its own, the directions say to set the temperature and then go set your own timer for 7 minutes to make sure it preheats. The buttons are also not true buttons. Sometimes they register what I’m trying to do and sometimes they do not. I have to tap them multiple times to change temp, time, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey M

customer_reviews.title: This is great for baking either regular or convection
customer_reviews.text: This is great for baking either regular or convection. The house doesn't get all heated up and the cooking is even. I am really shocked how good it is. The toasting is inconsistent but it is worth it for how well the oven works. I purchased the largest one which comes with to racks! Very handy. You can bake two pizzas at the same time! The lower elements do not toast the underside of bread with the same consistency as the upper. I don’t care for when you push the bake button it’s hard to know it is working immediately or not. There’s not a proper click sound but it does work. It will take some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: 3Ob1v7

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster Oven
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take on a Family Reunion Vacation & our hotel didn't have any ovens. We had partial kitchens, no ovens. So I ordered this, it arrived very well packaged, No damages, & on time. We All were extremely impressed with this toaster oven. It truly does fit any 9x13 pan & I even did a double batch of potato casserole in it & it cooked very well. Browned everything nicely. I Love it! It doesn't take up a lot of space & yet you can fit a big pan in it & it really does an incredible job. I'm more than satisfied with my purchase. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MistressB

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best thing I've ever bought for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This review is more so for toaster ovens as a concept than this specific oster model. I have just a standard oven so this is capable of doing: Convection Bake Toasting food Regular baking for small quantities of food in less time This effectively makes it better in every way to my regular oven except it can't fit large trays/amounts of food. It also is easier to clean than a normal oven. Also do to air fryers just being table top convection ovens this can effectively be used exactly the same as an air fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin G.

customer_reviews.title: Great little oven
customer_reviews.text: I previously had an Oyster toaster oven and after about ten years it was just starting to be unreliable so I ordered this Oyster toaster oven to replace it. I was blown away by how nice this oven looks and it works great. You’ll be very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jake's mom

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS TOASTER OVEN !!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been told Oster has reliable products. The woman who told me that must be insane. I bought this back in March. Here it is almost June. A whole 2 1/2 months. The junker is broken already. NONE of the keypad buttons will work...although the clock works for some reason. I tried unplugging it and plugging it back in. Didn't work. From the beginning the toaster part was slower than a snail with polio anyway. Toasting bread? You might as well brew a pot of coffee while you're waiting. What a mistake. An expensive mistake. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Black

customer_reviews.title: Love my Toaster Oven
customer_reviews.text: With 2 teenage grandsons who eat all hours of night and day, they were constantly running my large oven - making frozen pizza, chicken nuggets, burritos - you name it. They prefer them from the oven to microwave. But it overheated the house and made my electric bill soar. The toaster oven is such a great addition to my kitchen - now even on a 90 degree afternoon I barely notice when they decide it's time for a snack!
customer_reviews.author: Shari Sullivan Quinn

customer_reviews.title: First time we used the oven the glass shattered! ...
customer_reviews.text: First time we used the oven the glass shattered!!! Never had that happen I would give it a zero star if could not a safe product at all I
customer_reviews.author: Alva

customer_reviews.title: One original and one replacement oven - neither worked.
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these ovens and neither works properly. Oster sent me a replacement after the first oven would not toast. The oven could not be set for toast and would continue to heat no matter what time setting was entered. No bell for done. It just kept heating away and incinerated the toast. Both ovens were defective. Oster is sending me a different oven with dial controls. Wish me luck!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Bippus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent appliance
customer_reviews.text: I use this oven ALL the time. I can bake a 12 inch pizza, roasted potatoes, reheat, etc in this oven. The large size let's me have an additional oven in my small kitchen. The quality is great. It's easy to use and I like the oven light while baking. Don't listen to the negative reviews. These people are either clueless, unlucky or difficult to please. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Morales

customer_reviews.title: Large capacity and oven light.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an oven also capable of being a convection oven. This oven fits that category. It is easy to use although the buttons can be hard to press. Two of the best features is the crumb tray, easy to access and clean, but the best feature for me is the light in the oven. And you can turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Pam M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was a little nervous about the product. But, so far the unit I received is working great. For me, the unit is just the right size, it cooks evenly and the clock has not skipped a beat; its been right on, considering some write ups criticized the clocks accuracy. The timer for toast or warming items works great too. My older unit that went after a number of good years would overcook the food. This unit so far with the timer has been spot on. I understand that when mass producing a product, there could be some fallout. But for me, this one does exactly what it should.
customer_reviews.author: PeterC

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster oven!
customer_reviews.text: Great pretty big oven, I am very happy with it. I cook, bake, toast and warm food up in it. I got few stainless steel trays for it. I barely use my big oven now. I only had 1 issue with it - the clock was always off, I tried to set it up few times but it would get really off very quickly. It was OK because I don't need another clock in the kitchen. But after about a year all of the sudden the clock got stable, so I adjusted it and it's been fine for couple of months now.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful appliance as long as you check temp first before baking
customer_reviews.text: With the exception of the temperature being off about 25 degrees hotter than the read out, this larger toaster/convection over has proved to be a nice replacement for us as we go through a remodel. I can fit just about everything I have tried into it and as long as I pre heat & use a temp gauge inside the oven before I bake to make sure the temp is right on, it’s perfect! Made a 2 lb meatloaf in 45 min on convection bake and came out super juicy!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Conour

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: Cooks well. Came well packaged. I took a point away for the clock, as it does not work properly. The timer is not quite accurate either. Update : the clock and timer never worked right. Which means you have to set it the max time so it won't shut itself off too soon. The toaster varies on degree of browning from one time to the next time you use it (same bread and setting ) . So I wonder how much the temp. Varies when baking. Would change my rating to 2 and ahalf to 3.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this oven
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this oven. Used to have one in Hawaii. The only oven we used. It is perfect for a couple because you don't need a huge oven. The convection oven is awesome. I made a 10 gourmet hazelnut cake and it was baked to perfection in less time as well. Toaster function is great for toast. However, I love to heat up croissant in the oven and you have to watch it. Or it will burn quickly. Couldn't have been more happier with an investment. I am now wondering why we waited so long.
customer_reviews.author: salaya

customer_reviews.title: This oven makes the perfect frozen pizza
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Oster for 6 months now and I use it almost every day. This oven makes the perfect frozen pizza. The convection oven works well and I use this oven for everything from toast to egg rolls and chicken chunks. Pretty much any frozen food works well being baked in this oven. I lined the crumb tray with aluminum foil so clean up is breeze. The included broiler pan works well for french fries on the convection setting. I happen to think that this oven was a bargain when I paid $90 for it, but now at the time of this review the price is $69.99. The oven is still working great.
customer_reviews.author: Great Santini

customer_reviews.title: Great features, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Where I live it’s very hot in the summer and the last thing I wanna do is turn on the big oven to cook. I thought I’d give this little oven a try and much to my surprise everything that I have cooked and it has turned out perfectly. The convection option cuts cooking time by about 30%. The oven heats up quickly and cooked perfectly. And it doesn’t heat up my whole kitchen. I would highly recommend this it’s a great oven.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Hilliard

customer_reviews.title: Decent product ruined by poor product support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the convection oven and the interior light immediately burnt out. I emailed Oster customer service and received an email one week later asking for a bunch of proof of purchase information. I sent it in and no response. One week later I sent an email asking for status; nothing. One week later I sent another email asking about status; nothing. I will be sending the unit back and spending a little more for another unit with more features. One feature I would have liked is for the unit to display the measured temperature inside the unit instead of just the set temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Steve GL

customer_reviews.title: Quality product !
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough nice things about this product ! It seems to cook faster than I am used to so it did take a bit of getting used to initially Cleans quickly and easily ! lt lends itself to both cooking and baking so I am using it daily
customer_reviews.author: Pat Witt

customer_reviews.title: not temperature accurate
customer_reviews.text: Not very accurate. It keeps a consistent temperature which is what earns it 3 stars, but if you set it at say 275 (like I do for polymer clay), it will bake at 300. Set at 250 bakes at 275. You can only set the temperature at 25 degree increments, so if you need something that heats precisely like a clay oven, I would look somewhere else. Also theres a decent gap between the crumb tray and glass. The digital buttons are a bit sluggish as well.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Very Good unit
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this for a week, and cooked three items/meals in it so far. This is our third unit over twenty years and first Oster. We are very happy so far. Like the LED window info and ease of adjusting. Outside does not get to hot and door handle keeps cool. We also like the pull out crumb tray upfront. The Light inside is also a big feature. Also a plus, very quiet with fan on.
customer_reviews.author: Seaweid

customer_reviews.title: A really great toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: My whole family loves this toaster oven. I use it as quick oven for pizza. It even has a defrosts icon. Its very efficient, easy to use. Love that it lights up when in use. It makes great toast. My kids love to toast their corn muffins. They come out perfect. Its also a convection oven and does not take up much room. This Oster toaster oven was just what I was looking for after trying 3 other ones. I highly recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: NJ flower

customer_reviews.title: We use it a lot!
customer_reviews.text: We got a toaster oven to heat up the apartment less during the summer, since we live on the 3rd floor and the air conditioner rarely turns off on hot Missouri summer days. It has been used a lot and we tend to cook anything small enough in the toaster oven rather than the full size oven. It does really well with cookies and chicken breasts, but I would recommend baking things like pies and cornbread in a larger oven, or cook at a low temperature, because following recipes tends to result in really dark top and bottom by the time the center is done.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Tried three other toaster ovens before this. This toaster oven works great. Would definitely buy again. Easy to clean. Just make sure you preheat before baking.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: CLOCK RUNS FAST
customer_reviews.text: While this Toaster Oven is spacious and easy to use, it has one glaring flaw. The clock RUNS FAST. It will deviate noticeably within a few hours. After a week, it's 15 minutes off. Maybe it was just the unit we received? NO, the replacement unit is doing the same thing! Will be returning that one, this time, as soon as a better brand can be found. See above picture. These 2 started out synchronized. Sure, we already a clock on the microwave. What's the big deal? It's incredibly annoying. That's the big deal. What the hell is the point of having a clock feature ifnit fails to work properly??!
customer_reviews.author: J. R

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: We have an older model that just got tired out. New one works even better, more heat and nicer bells and whistles. Improved along the way. We use it all the time, from toasting to baking. Large but not to big. Glad we bought another one. The price is right also.
customer_reviews.author: Allagorb

customer_reviews.title: Love this oven
customer_reviews.text: My sister had one and every time I'm over we used it. I just fell in love with the fact that I didn't have to turn on my oven. I had another Oster toaster oven and it's still good gave it to my son and he loves it. I read some reviews that it took for ever to toast toast and that the heat escape from the bottom so far I haven't had any of these issues.All I can say is where have you been all my life.
customer_reviews.author: Angel22

customer_reviews.title: Huge Bang for the Buck!!
customer_reviews.text: Had a mid-level KitchenAid convection/toaster oven that broke down after just about 18 months and was horrible at toasting bread. After a good amount of research, I decided to give this Oster a try, as it had especially good reviews from Consumer Reports. This thing is far superior to the KitchenAid in toasting -- even single slices -- and is equal if not slightly better on Bake mode. Plenty of oven space, too.
customer_reviews.author: Grape Ape

customer_reviews.title: It developed sentience and cooks my food perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for a year and I love it. And I'm not trying to be funny, I think it has developed sentience. It always know when my food is ready and shuts off and beeps. And most of the time I get annoyed at first because I wanted to cook my food for longer. But 99% of the time it is right and I am wrong and it cooked the food perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two bad units in a row
customer_reviews.text: Received the first one and multiple bars on the display did not work. The 2nd one worked fine, then after 8 months started doing what is in the pictures - lots of bars now not working. Will not buy again, may not even buy Oster again. Customer service has gone dark on me after I sent them pics
customer_reviews.author: SonnyInJerseyCity

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse ...with issues
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this oven for over two years. Convection temps are between 25° to 50° lower than indicated (e.g., 450° indicated = 400° actual). Clock loses approximately 5 minutes per week and must be reset accordingly. On my unit the digital display second from left digit horizontal element burned out just this week. Otherwise, to date, this unit has been a reliable workhorse and has provided good value relative to unit cost.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: We are so glad we ditched our old toaster and bought this. We use it literally every. single. day. Pizza, cookies, roasted veggies, buns, sandwiches - you name it. It's so much more efficient than heating up a whole oven.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa M.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly for quick heat-ups of leftovers and pizza. The toast function takes forever and burns the toast on the factory setting. The pizza function will burn the pizza every time. You have to stand in front of it and watch it as you cannot change the time on the pre-programmed button. It is an above average toaster oven but with the reservations noted.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: I was very sad when I had to replace my previous toaster oven of over 18 years! I am happy to say that we have kept on cooking with our new toaster oven! I use it nearly everyday for roasting vegetables. We also use it for toast, bacon, broiling meats out of our instant pot, and baking biscuits. I love the large size and sleek design. The interior and exterior are both easy to keep clean. I really love the interior light. The one downside is the buttons can be hard to push but we like everything else about it so we live with that minor annoyance. Hopefully it will last us a long while.
customer_reviews.author: Jacq

customer_reviews.title: Heat is Strong
customer_reviews.text: The temperature is so strong that makes the food burnt even though I followed the instructions on baking. I usually lower down the temperature by 25 degrees F. However, I like the way it is designed and this is useful when you’re not going to bake large amount of food as well. It’s also looks pretty in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena Mae Brock

customer_reviews.title: Digital Display
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this oven from Amazon 07/17/2018, it is used a few times a week. It is the perfect size (even make pizza in it) and very convenient. We were pleased until a few months ago as part of a digit quit displaying but we were still able to use it. Now there are more digits failing still able to use but if any more fail the unit will no longer be usable. I am not sure if a display board is available. I will leave the good review for now as it is still usable but if the display becomes totally unusable then the oven will be useless.
customer_reviews.author: PUM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for a small kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for a somewhat small kitchen, but it still is large enough to bake almost everything I need. I may never have to use my oven again. Every toaster I have ever owned has never toasted both sides of the bread evenly. This makes perfect evenly cooked toast. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Morgie

customer_reviews.title: Be wary of the digital aspects!
customer_reviews.text: BUT..... after about five weeks, the digital clock stopped keeping anywhere near accurate time. [I recorded its time against another clock and it continually sped up, becoming hours off overnight!] While this doesn't affect the other operation of the product at this time, I am very vary that it will since the whole appliance is digital. I thought I'd just send it back and re-order another, chancing it would work properly, but the new price was about eight dollars higher and that wasn't acceptable to me. To individuals considering this item, be warned. Yours might operate perfectly or it might start to have problems not long after purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought for older male relative. He finds it easy to use, buttons are easy to push, display is bright enough for him to see comfortably. Loves having an oven he doesn't have to bend down and struggle at a weird level for him--doesn't bake/broil anything large. Temperature is accurate. Toast takes a while, but "I'm not going anywhere fast", for what it's worth! Recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: public1

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this thing
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this thing! I can't believe how much I've already used it! Well made, toasts and bakes very well and highly functional. It DOES fit a 13x9 pan...it just won't fit one with any kind of handle. Same is true for a large muffin tin, etc. NOT a big deal and pans that fit it are easy to find. Don't hesitate to buy this!
customer_reviews.author: J. Upton

customer_reviews.title: The clock went bonkers, but still a good toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: Nice little toaster oven, though the convection function is more of a novelty than anything. It works well at doing what it's intended for, and is a breeze to clean. One weird thing, however - the clock has gone crazy. It can cover about 3-4 minutes in the span of just one earth minute. Completely unreliable, and unfortunately no way of turning it off. So it loses a star for the clock issue, but a great toaster oven otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: The Nik

customer_reviews.title: very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: our 5-8 year old kitchen-aid analog toaster over gave out , im kinda gifted in fixing things. before taking it apart, i was sure it was probably a main thermal fuse. after quickly taking it apart, found NO fuse plus no wire diaghragm available.on top of that all functions and numbers were hard to see. bought it cause it was kithhen-aid, top of line.... yea right. paid over 200.00. found this Oster on amazon to replace it at half the price. its digital an real easy to use. check it out , about same size as other one and looks a hole lot nicer. we are really happy with it. thanks
customer_reviews.author: frankvoynar

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to operate, nice unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 79 year old Mother and Father, they love it. I was scared at first because it is digital, but they got it and programmed the clock right away, I'm happy with my purchase. We live in AZ, and it is112 degrees right now so this is something they can keep on the outside, cover up when not in use and I just love how happy they were to receive this,
customer_reviews.author: Someone she knows

customer_reviews.title: Oster Countertop Oven
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this oven after reading the many reviews. It is larger than the one it replaced and I like all the features. The interior light is nice to have. I have not tried the convection option yet but intend to soon. The removable crumb tray makes for easy cleaning too. The unit is easy to operate and all features work without any problems. I am very happy to have this new oven.
customer_reviews.author: jopo

customer_reviews.title: Great oven!
customer_reviews.text: Although I have a large oven, bending over and lifting is tough, and this is just the right size for servings for 2. I have a formica top on my cabinets so I place a pot holder for the door to sit on should I need it. Because it's a toaster oven - it's going to get hot, so I use my head. It bakes my homemade bread and everything else very nice. A little learning curve thats all. Love the light. Thats extra value for sure. I checked them all for a long time. I have a Oster breadmaker too and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this new oven. Got the one with convection and happy with that feature. I did not rate easy to clean because I've never had to clean it, I expect it will be easy. Bigger than my old oven, takes up more counter space. Yes, I recommend this oven. Delivery was so quick and product well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Moore

customer_reviews.title: Handy dandy Amazon Choice is now a Gordon Choice as well! :-)
customer_reviews.text: I was fully prepared to buy a much more expensive brand like Cuisinart or Breville but as I always trust Amazon Choice reviews I made this purchase a couple weeks ago. I cannot be more pleased with its snappy operation. Fast heating, amazing convection facility, large capacity, LOW price make it an excellent choice for me. Very easy operation. I like it that the bottom tray slides out for cleaning without having to open the door. (I covered it with a sheet of aluminum foil for further ease of use.) This is another Amazon Choice that makes me very satisfied. Thanks, Jeff! :-)
customer_reviews.author: G. McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This toaster oven is an inferior product Pushing the function button are a hit and miss You have to push them hard that you will break your arm Most of the time no response Not a product you should ever own Toaster function is way beyond repair Returned after a day of use
customer_reviews.author: Justin Green

customer_reviews.title: SHE LOVED IT
customer_reviews.text: My 98 year old Aunt in Woodburn OR old convention/toaster oven finally died. I ordered this one and within 2 days she got the order and is "giddy" as a kid! This is a staple she uses daily and in the heat this summer I could not allow her to use her kitchen as she lives alone. This one sets on a shelf above her washer dryer in her garage. Her words " It's soooo pretty and bigger inside then my old one"! Needless to say she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Jo

product_meta.title: Oster Toaster Oven | Digital Convection Oven, Large 6-Slice Capacity, Black/Polished Stainless
product_meta.description: Precaution: Do not touch hot surfaces. Always use oven mitts when handling hot materials and allow metal parts to cool before cleaning. Allow the unit to cool thoroughly before putting in or taking off parts. Always use the oven handles when moving the unit. Perfect for large families, this countertop oven from Oster comes equipped with convection technology, which means it distributes heat quickly and evenly for thorough cooking and excellent results. The oven provides a large interior that can accommodate a frozen pizza, a whole chicken, a casserole, or even a pan of crescent rolls or chocolate-chip cookies. Two rack positions allow for customizing the space, especially helpful when cooking a tall roast. Furthermore, the sleek, modern-looking unit features a stainless finish frame and a user-friendly manual/digital control panel for convenient operation. Choose from a variety of cooking functions, including Bake, Convection Bake, Broil, Toast, Pizza, Defrost and Warm. Adjust time and temperature using one touch controls. Other highlights include a see-through door that allows for checking on food at a glance, an optional interior light, an easy-to-clean interior, and an external removable crumb tray. A durable baking pan comes included. Black housing with chrome accents.
feature_bullets: 6 slice convection toaster oven for faster, more even cooking. This Oster Large Digital Countertop Oven can fit up a pan with the measure of 2 inches height, 10.5 inches width and 12.5 inches length
Convection technology and a wide temperature range of 150 to 450 degrees F let you cook with the convenience of an oven
Digital controls with 7 cooking settings and an interior light for easy viewing
Large interior can accommodate one 12 inch pizza, casseroles, cookies, and even a roast; Oven measures 19.72 w x 16.29 d x 11.33 h inches, with 31.5 inch cord
Includes Durable baking pan and removable crumb tray for easy cleanup. Watts: 1300w

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars5,906 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
